website_summaries.verdict: In general, people liked the NB 877 for its comfort. They were also happy with the fact that their feet did not feel tired after prolonged walking in the shoe. Despite a comparatively small amount of negative feedback, the number of shoe's positive assets made it one of the top choices among walking footwear.
pros: Almost all of the owners marveled at the overall cushion of the New Balance 877 because it delivered extreme comfort
A good number of users loved that it was available from narrow to wide options because they were able to find the perfect fit
The deep toe box was appreciated by countless people because it was able to accommodate custom orthotics, prosthetics, and braces
The product was reasonably priced because of the quality it offered, according to a myriad of buyers
The arch and the ankle support brought by the footgear was deemed sufficient by numerous testers
Multiple wearers claimed that this model alleviated foot problems such as plantar fasciitis, bunions, and corns
The lightweight nature of this merchandise pleased several individuals
cons: The shoe was stiff which irritated the ankle and caused foot fatigue for a number of commenters
A few people remarked that the foot chamber was not adequately ventilated
The minority claimed that it felt heavy

customer_reviews.title: What Happened to New Balance Quality?
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, New Balance shoe quality is really going downhill. The "higher" number NB shoes have historically been of high-quality, with firm suede/leather sides and nylon mesh, with very sturdy soles. I've worn them for years, and love them. HOWEVER, this pair of shoes feels flimsy... arch support is much less than older models, and overall, the shoe feels more like a nylon slipper for the beach instead of a first-class walking shoe! If this is what NB is selling as a MW877, it's the last purchase I'll ever make! Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mesh/Suede version of 577
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is essentially a version of the New Balance 577 with mesh and suede instead of leather. I have owned multiple pairs of the 577 and my only complaint is that my feet get hot and sweat, not with this shoe. It is very lightweight and airs out well. Supreme comfort, looks terrific too. I wish New Balance would make this shoe in solid black, I expect to be buying many pairs of these in the future with the amount of walking I do. It is also one of the only shoes that New Balance makes that actually fits people with wide feet as a 4E shoe is expected to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Brother Jerome

customer_reviews.title: Finally my pinky toes aren't mashed.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pair of shoes I've owned in a long time that have a wide enough toe box that my pinky toes aren't getting mashed. Most other shoes, even wide width shoes taper too much to fit me properly. I originally bought these only for walking, but find myself wearing them more often than my regular shoes now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Saville

customer_reviews.title: This Shoe Is In  My Goldilocks Zone!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is the cats pajamas for me. It is the first such shoe that I have bought in years that does not hurt my feet. My foot is between a wide and a regular. The regulars were too narrow and the wide shoes were too wide. This shoe is just right. It has a nice boxy toe box that gives my foot the room it needs. I have always bought running shoes but decided to give this a try since I don't run anymore. For walking, I could not ask for a more comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time, no arch at all. 100% flat.
customer_reviews.text: They advertised as walking shoes. How do you walk with shoes that have "0" arch support? If you have fred flintstone Flat Feet, these are for you. If you have an arch like most of the human race, do not waste your time. Wasted my time...
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Comfort?  I say not.
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the worst New Balance product I have ever purchased. UGLY freaking shoe that does not fit! Material bunches in places which unbeknownst to me was digging into my foot which caused discomfort when I removed them until the skin bounced back about a half hour later. They look like they should have Velcro fasteners. Already gave them to the thrift store.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: I'm done with New Balance
customer_reviews.text: These are awful shoes. New Balance used to make great shoes and I've worn them for over thirty years. These are so poorly made that I will never buy another pair of their shoes. The fit was inconsistent with other pairs of their walking shoes and the materials are just cheap. I went to a shoe store to find a new pair of shoes and they were appalled when they saw these, and that they were made by New Balance. Out with the trash.
customer_reviews.author: P. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Check this item carfully
customer_reviews.text: I have been a big fan of New Balance for some time. In fact this is my third pair I have bought through Amazon. This pair however came in a box which lead me to believe they were either used or at the minimum returned. The shoes were already laced up, there were no tags on them, and there was no paper or inserts of any kind. I am tempted to send them back, but don't have the time to mess with it any further. I will not be buying any further foot ware through Amazon in the future and would encourage you to inspect them carefully if you buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Semon

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit; too much shoe lace!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 11.5D, which has been my size for years. There is not enough toe room. My big toe touches the front (slightly) It fits fine in every other area however; I'm quite sure a larger size will not do. So, I am stretching the shoes with shoe trees. We'll see. PET PEEVE....why do all athletic shoes come with SHOE LACES THAT ARE ENTIRELY TOO LONG?? I literally have 8-10 inches of shoe lace on each end to deal with when my shoe is fully laced up! I have to "double tie" the bow, or trip over all that shoe lace! C'mon guys!!
customer_reviews.author: Phil B.

customer_reviews.title: First 30 miles . . .
customer_reviews.text: For the past ten days I've walked three miles every morning in gray New Balance Men's MW877 Walking Shoes. They're pretty comfortable and show no signs of wear. I had some serious misgivings about purchasing shoes off the internet, but I used an on-line calculator to determine my 11 wide shoe size and these shoes fit perfectly. These New Balance shoes have a decent grip even on wet concrete. My single complaint is that they need more cushioning on the soles. I'm a big guy so I'll add a thin rubber insert. At the price I give these shoes a 4 to 4-1/2 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: hotdog12

customer_reviews.title: There is to much mesh and my feet got wet just walking through wet grass also the suede acts like a sponge so they never dry out
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is okay for fair weather but dont get caught out in the rain or the cold. There is to much mesh and my feet got wet just walking through wet grass also the suede acts like a sponge so they never dry out. Horrible design. I have wet feet now just from walking through the wet grass
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet, Happy Life
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd pair. This pair is a little different than prior model but still a great day-to-day kick around shoe and walking shoe. Arch support as delivered was not sufficient for my very high arch. But I have this arch issue with every shoe I order. I ordered some NB insoles with high arch support. Works well. I’ve seen some shoes where they have laces but shoes are easy to slip on without undoing laces. Some how the shoe self tighten 0s once foot in shoe. I’d like to see NB go that way. I still hate tying my shoes. Wah wah wah
customer_reviews.author: BTM

customer_reviews.title: New Balance Fails
customer_reviews.text: I have worn NB shoes for many years and enjoyed them all for work, hiking, walking and the tennis court. These shoes are poorly designed with a flat bottom..........new technology or want to save the company money who knows. You at NB need some lessons in A and P and watch others walk. I will return these and not purchase another NB until y'all can design a decent shoe again.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Bowyer

customer_reviews.title: New balance sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my husband who has trouble finding wide enough shoes/sneakers. New Balance seems to be the only one that carries 4E. He has had trouble in the past w/newbalance as far as comfort and holding up for any period of time. I paid a bit more for these hoping that the durability will be better. Will have to see. THe fit and looks are very good.
customer_reviews.author: gSee

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe for a job where you walk and stand a lot
customer_reviews.text: I work in retail, stock in the mornings. Its the best shoe I've ever worn where I have to stand and walk a lot, which is saying since I walk 8000 to 10000 steps each day 5 hours straight. For the value its great. Over one year later, I used to work 5 5 hours shifts a week, now only 4, they're still in great shape, though the inside sole is showing a little wear. They look great in real life, better than the photo online.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Chang

customer_reviews.title: A very good walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: The quality is very good. the fit was excellent straight out of the box (x-wide) with ample toe box. The sole is a true walking sole (smooth paths and sidewalks- not a hiker) I walk 6-8 miles per day, I usually get 2 months out of shoes due to wear on the soles, so far I have 100+ miles on these and so far wear is minimal. Great comfort and nice and cool. At this price I can't find an alternative that fits, feels and wears like these do.
customer_reviews.author: Dan M

customer_reviews.title: Ok for price,  I’ll get the better models next times.
customer_reviews.text: Meh Not as good as the more expensive ones- imagine that. Wanted to try a different style then my usual ones— and to see of o like a shoe for less then 125 bucks. I’ve got a closet full of the basic walking shoes from the past 20+ years,,,,, I’m a big fat old geezer- though I’ve lost 120 lbs, need to lose more so this old guy can ride his KTM525. I’ve got 2 fairly fresh pairs of better models,,, next pair o get will be back to a higher end model. Yay New Balance Boo Nike. Just Don’t do it Nike. Kirkpatrick only cemented my dislike of Nike, in my humble opinion, NB makes far better shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Alan S. Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: So far the best walking shoes I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: These are surprisingly light, well ventilated and soft walking shoes! I don't notice any major difference compared with more expensive 928's (which are heavier and more advanced - they have roll bar inside) in terms of cushioning. So for me, these are the perfect walking shoes. And they fit perfectly! I just hope they last long because my left 928 started squeaking after a few months - total bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gonchar

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: As you can see after being worn three time they started coming apart. Too bad they were comfortable. Returned them and got pair of running NB.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality product.  Last a very long time.  Extremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Have owned four pair so far. Just ordered two more pair. With length and width sizing, AZ may not have your exact size all the time. Watch the site and buy when they have both the size and width you need. I walk about three miles per day. Shoes show significant wear at about eight months or so, but can last a full year. Totally solid support all the way. Also like the colors and the look and feel of the shoe. Long time big fan of NB. Plan to continue with this first class product and its successors.
customer_reviews.author: John Sinde

customer_reviews.title: Stick with a running shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe looks great and fits well, but....The arch support is almost non-existent as well as padding in the heal and toe. I was a former runner but after 2 hip replacements I now walk 5-6 miles a day, 7 days a week. I've always used running shoes but though I give a walking shoe a try. I wanted something that looked good other than the typical Velcro laced shoes. I don't recommend this shoe if you usually buy running shoes for walking. IMO you will be disappointed. If you buy running shoes in the $45-$100 range - stick with them.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Six years, 12 pairs of this shoe - fits perfect every time - best walking shoe I've found
customer_reviews.text: I've probably worn every major brand of shoes for walking over the last couple of decades. And every type from running shoes to lightweight trail hiking shoes. Once I found the New Balance MW877 I've stayed with it. Every pair of the dozen or so I've purchased has fit exactly like every other pair. Consistency of fit is challenging to find these days but the New Balance MW877 delivers. Assembled in the USA of foreign and domestic content. That's about as US made as you will find in a shoe these days. I walk about 15-20 miles a week and these MW877s are key to my ability to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gato

customer_reviews.title: Knee pain
customer_reviews.text: The sole is too firm and shoe is too heavy on my ankle. I never thought that I can have serious knee pain from shoes, guess what... I had after JUST 2 days of wearing those shoes! I like NB but guys, listen to your body and explore until you find the ultimate working shoes for your feet. It’s not enough to be comfy while walking but It’s crucial to be gentle on your heels after prolong time of standing on spot. Also consider that after 6 hours of walking around your feet will got swallow make sure that you have enough room aroud your toes!
customer_reviews.author: Borislav Donchev

customer_reviews.title: Go-To summer shoe for a shoe wrecker
customer_reviews.text: My hubby is REALLY hard on shoes and clothes. We walk a lot, so he needs good sturdy shoes that can take a beating. I will update this after a summer of wear. He liked the fit (wide enough) , the tough laces (he really tightens them down) and the gray color (matches most of the dirt around here). These are also supportive, with enough leather (or pleather) on the outside to keep feet from breaking through, and enough fabric for feet to breathe. All in all a winner. Will buy again unless they discontinue this model. He's always had good luck with New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: Doc W8

customer_reviews.title: Great wide size shoe
customer_reviews.text: Those of us with wide feet will always have trouble finding shoes that fit comfortably, these NB shoes were just what I was looking for. After a week of wearing them I can say that my feet don't feel cramped into the shoe space, they fit perfectly. I've had NB shoes like these before and they do tend to wear out a bit sooner than others, but that's a price I'm willing to pay for the comfort they deliver. Only wish for more style choices and you will need an insole for better arch support.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: great walking sneakers - laces are terrible
customer_reviews.text: Love the sneakers, very comfy and great support for long speed walks. The problem is with the laces on these and other New Balances I have bought recently - The laces are so long that even if you triple tie them they are hanging all over the sides and flop around. I have ended up having to buy new laces and you can not find the heavy duty replacements like the original ones that came with the sneakers. I expect better from New Balance
customer_reviews.author: DSM1902

customer_reviews.title: The pair we got was a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I buy New Balance shoes for myself and my family at the recommendation of my podiatrist, and they are usually satisfactory. However this pair of size 14 I bought for my son, while being quite comfortable, proved to be of very poor quality. They started coming apart at the seams shortly after he wore them, and now are completely useless. I am wondering if they are counterfeit since they are not up to the usual quality of New Balance. Not only that, they appeared to have been returns, because there was pet hair in one of the shoes when we took it out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Lightseeker

customer_reviews.title: Built in the USA
customer_reviews.text: It was finally great to get a pair of walking shoes that fit just right. I used to run a lot but now prefer to walk. My feet are not exactly the same size. I have had problems with this in the past. Most of the time I preferred a cheaper version of same shoe. Although I paid more this time it was worth it to get the write fit, 10.5 2W right on the button and guess why? Built in the USA!
customer_reviews.author: Mdjhk

customer_reviews.title: Terrible insoles - replace with better ones
customer_reviews.text: For a $75 pair of shoes, I'd expect the insole to be both durable and comfortable. They were neither. The insoles wore out, as in disintegrated, within a week of wear. Replaced them with Dr. Scholl's Sport running insoles with better cushioning and that worked great, eliminating the shin splints and ball of foot pain that these poorly implemented insoles were giving me. Shame I had to spend and extra $15 to get usable shoes, but that's how New Balance is these days. Otherwise, they seem okay. They fit very nicely and are otherwise comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Houseknecht

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little small, needs more support and cushioning.
customer_reviews.text: Frankly, I am disappointed with these shoes. In the past, I have had very good luck with New Balance in the fit and comfort but, with these shoes, I felt like I really had to put some effort into each step in order to get up to a "stride" and there is just not enough support in the ball-of-the-foot for me. I do a LOT of walking on pavement and my feet were really sore after walking a few miles. Went back to my old running type shoes for now. Too bad as this ended-up being a waste of money due to "no return" policy by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mad About Reading

customer_reviews.title: Really uncomfortable and super ugly. This is supposed to be a walking ...
customer_reviews.text: Really uncomfortable and super ugly. This is supposed to be a walking shoe, but it feels more like a torture shoe. I am so glad I can return them. Also, oddly was a slight bit tight on the toe area. Again, hideous and incredibly uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Music

customer_reviews.title: Happy to Get New Balance Shoes Online
customer_reviews.text: Pleased to get a pair of New Balance Walking Shoes for my husband online. His walking shoes needed to be replaced. He likes the fit and said they are comfortable. The support is a little different from his last pair of New Balance. But, he thinks they will give him a good six-months of wear, which is normal for him.
customer_reviews.author: Rosy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Painful Defect Stabs Your Heels
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have a serious defect that causes physical pain. Underneath the insole are hard rubbery/plasticky projections. It feels like walking on knives. And now I am stuck with these foot-stabbing defects. Amazon refused to help when we called them on the phone. So I am now without wearable shoes or the money I used to purchase them.
customer_reviews.author: Washington State

customer_reviews.title: Moved from a D size to 2E wide per Podiatrist and my feet are happier.
customer_reviews.text: NB Men's MW877 walking shoes are still my go-to shoes for walking comfort. I am flat footed, have extreme neuropathy in both feet, hammer toes, recurring callous buildup on tips of toes and bottom of feet. Must be regularly treated by a Podiatrist every 6-8 weeks. If you suffer from the same types of pain/discomfort that I do these walking shoes may work for you. No promise. However, I highly recommend them. Received a new pair last Friday MW877GT, 11.5 2E from A Perfect Dealer (thru Amazon) for $89.00. Shoes strings finally shortened and they wear well.! Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: James .

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I liked every aspect of this shoe. I had been using running shoes for brisk distance walking and my toes were always cramped even though I have a normal width foot. These walking shoes have a more normal and squared toe box and accommodate my feet perfectly. Just what I have been seeking. I purchased the 11.5 regular model.
customer_reviews.author: Guy's Rating

customer_reviews.title: So far I've only walked 20 miles in my new 877s but so far so good. I can definitely tell the difference from trying ...
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a big fan of New Balance running shoes, so when I had to switch from running to walking in order to maintain my fitness I figured I'd give their walking shoes a try. So far I've only walked 20 miles in my new 877s but so far so good. I can definitely tell the difference from trying to walk in running shoes...much smoother and much less foot movement in these shoes. I'm not sure how they will wear...I'm noticing some scuffing on the heal already but no visible wear at this point. My biggest concern is overall life...hoping to get at least 500 miles out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W. Kilgo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a wide foot. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I love these NB shoes! I wear an 11 wide (2E), and these shoes are the most comfortable that I have found over the years. I'm on my fourth pair of these and will continue to buy them as long as they are being made. I have a bunion on my left foot that in most shoes is very painful. However in these shoes, there is mesh fabric in that bunion area which allows for plenty of flexibility in that area. Some other reviewers complain that NB quality has gone down, but I don't see that with this shoe, it's very well made.
customer_reviews.author: S. Zavori

customer_reviews.title: Beware of an insole manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: Initially the shoes fit well, but after a month of walking 3-4 miles a day... I developed blisters on the bottom/back of both heels... but couldn't figure out what was causing the blisters... until I looked closely and saw small white plastic 'pins' where the insole material had worn off. These 'alignment' pins? protruded into the insole and appear to have been misaligned during manufacturing. Of course I was a month too late, when I discovered this and couldn't return the shoes... To other buyers... beware of this defect in the MW877 walking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I was walking on an indoor track with the wrong shoes and I started to develop foot problems. They were two narrow and they pinched my toes causing some of my toe nails to turn black. After doing a lot of research, I purchased a pair of the New Balance walking shoes and I'm extremely happy with them. My feet are healing and I purchased another pair so I could use them to walk out doors.
customer_reviews.author: M. CLAGUE

customer_reviews.title: Update on shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have walked a few miles in these so far, and I am pleased. The size was correct for me compared to my NB running shoes. I can't run so I was looking for some walkers when I saw these. They look so much like my running shoes I have to look closely before I put them on. For the price these are excellent, and the fit and comfort is NB. Update: The comfort wore out right away and they became loose to fit on the width. The heel also broke down pretty fast and now i'm ordering running shoes again for walking. I wouldn't recommend these if you have problem feet.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: mostly happy husband's feet
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, excellent price, good fit. My husband hates shopping for anything, so we were happy to find these Wide shoes - big absence of wide versions of any shoe on a certain shoe site (with a Z). They arrived on time, he put them on, and they fit well - much better than most of what he tried on over the time since I got him the previous pair (which he has worn until disintegration). He isn't sure it is as fully wide as labeled, but it is better than when he gets much longer (and thus wider by default), only to have them flop.
customer_reviews.author: Daryle

customer_reviews.title: Arch in wrong place for me
customer_reviews.text: I wear primarily New Balance shoes since I have wide feet and most fit perfectly. This shoe's arch is about 2 cm too far forward and very painful to wear for prolonged periods. I have tried to get used to them since we accidentally threw out the box and cannot return them. It is not happening. Ordered a different New Balance model that fits great so these are gathering dust in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: DrBiff

customer_reviews.title: Long and Snug
customer_reviews.text: Long shoe length was my issue. I ordered a mens 11 1/2 medium. I have a size 12 arch and can get by with an 11 1/2 or 12 mens with medium width. My foot is 10 7/8' (27.6 cm) long. The MW877 shoes fit my width and heel just fine; however, I had almost 3/4" of shoe beyond my big toe! Taking a smaller size, conservatively 10 1/2, would not fit because of arch and perhaps even width. The shoe was very comfortable and I could imagine walking on hard surfaces with ease. I just couldn't imagine what the foot that fit this shoe would look like!
customer_reviews.author: Ravin' Mad

customer_reviews.title: Shoe is not performing as anticipated!
customer_reviews.text: I received the shoe on May 1st- attached are photos from today- the 30th of July. This is what they look like after 3 months of usage. I have purchased this brand before and never had this sort of issue but it appears as if their quality has gone downhill very quickly - very disappointed in purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bestboxers

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate support, feel too soft. Nicely made
customer_reviews.text: These feel great when you first put them on. But when walking for any distance, even on our apartment carpet, I can tell that these do not have sufficient underfoot support. Perhaps a replacement insole would help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes but terrible insole
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews have stated, there is no support insole in these shoes. It appears to be a cheap piece of Styrofoam. Everything else seems ok. I order wide width and that seems perfect. Added my own arch support insole and will keep them. Very disappointed in the way New Balance is going though. I had a pair of gray 619s that were amazing. They fit perfect, had excellent insoles. Not these.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these sneakers two years ago. They were very comfortable and held up well to two years of abuse. I wear them at work, in a warehouse environment plus around the house. When the old ones started to wear out, I went to my orders and clicked buy again. The new ones are not the same as what I had before. They look the same, but boy are they uncomfortable. There is no cushion at all, feels like I'm walking on concrete. And they seem smaller/tighter than the previous pair I had. I'll keep them to use for river wading shoes, but think this will be my last pair of NB..
customer_reviews.author: byron eckardt

customer_reviews.title: Mesh on top of shoe doesn’t hold
customer_reviews.text: Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. I previously bought this item once before and the same thing happened. The toe breaks thru the mesh on top and produces a hole in the shoe as seen in the photo. I’m an avid exercise walker; however, this happen only after two or three months of use. The reason I bought this shoe after It happening the first was because I’ve always used New Ballance products in the past and was very satisfied with them but not this time.
customer_reviews.author: John F. ODonohue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent walking shoe for after ankle surgery rehabilitation
customer_reviews.text: After ankle surgery I needed a walking shoe that could wrap around my ankle support my feet and be very confortable. I also needed enough room inside to accommodate an additional dr scholls insole for plantar fasciitis that helps very much on the recovery. This shoe is the best for all of this. Excellent and very confortable. So much that is my second pair I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: ery comfortable for people who need more room for their toes
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear the New Balance 574 model shoe, because my big toes come almost straight out from the ball of my foot. I could not find the 574 in my size. This shoe has a similar toe box so I opted for it. The reviews indicated it runs a little larger than expected, so I ordered 1/2 size smaller than normal. The fit is perfect, and the toe box is even larger than the 574.
customer_reviews.author: Earl S.

customer_reviews.title: My Toes aren’t pinched!
customer_reviews.text: As I grow older, I have a harder time finding comfortable shoes. I ordered these after seeing the listing of box toe....they are very comfortable. I have been buying NB for years, and these are why.
customer_reviews.author: Toyboy

customer_reviews.title: room for toes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a lazy 'vacation shoe' and that's about where it ends. Lightweight, comfortable, cool, almost like walking barefoot. The heel sits a little lower than I expected. Not necessarily a bad thing but I like a little more cushion when my heel strikes the ground. Step on any kind of pebble and you will feel it more than you want to. Only real disappointment was discovering how bad they stain. Tried washing a bit of gunk off and only made the stain fade a bit while spreading larger. I've been buying new balance for years but will not buy this style again.
customer_reviews.author: My Name Here

customer_reviews.title: Happy walker
customer_reviews.text: I got my "Clown Shoes" yesterday and they gave me a fright at first glance :-)...after 5 years of walking in Brooks/Ghosts I wanted something designed for walking which is what I do these days, in particular a heel with rocker. I walked my 3 miles this morning, I walk as fast as possible without looking silly, and I was very happy with the shoe and the rocking heel. Much of my walk is on uneven compacted shell trail and the broad flatter base of this shoe was comfortable as well as the flex reliefs on the sole...I am a happy walker with a saving$ over the Brooks...Bradenton,Florida
customer_reviews.author: Tad

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is an avid walker. He mentioned one day that his current sneakers were hurting his feet. I checked the shoes and there was virtually no padding in the soles! After doing some research, we decided on the New Balance Men's 877 V1 Walking Shoe. He loves them, and says that he walks are much more comfortable now!
customer_reviews.author: STim

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable. Not for heavier guys.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve walked in them in Portugal, Israel, France and at home. Unbeatable comfort; best I’ve ever had, however they don’t seem to offer the kind of support that I, as a bigger and older guy need. I grew fatigued and found that I dreaded the last mile I had to go of a 4-5 mile walk. They felt flat. I’d recommend them however for a daily, all purpose shoe but they’re not made for a heavier walker with a distance in mind.
customer_reviews.author: John V Herrmann

customer_reviews.title: Fit well but weren't for my feet
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research into walking shoes and these come very highly rated. They fit very well but never seemed to break in and caused my feet to start hurting more, and eventually my knees. I've stopped wearing and switched to memory foam shoes but I think that's simply the type of shoe that works better for my body type.
customer_reviews.author: jjpauli

customer_reviews.title: lasted only 3 months
customer_reviews.text: bought these in April and already started coming apart and getting a hole at the toe line. I did not get them caught in anything to produce the tear. Now have to look for another shoe.
customer_reviews.author: sleddogs

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t fit
customer_reviews.text: Shoe was too large for me. My size is 9 4E so this shoe did not fit. Went to brick and mortar store so I could try on many sizes and models. That worked great for me. Hard to get just right fit for shoes by online shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Worn out in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Delivered July 2. Picture taken October 19. Soles worn through both shoes. A few weeks over 3 months. I walk a lot but the accelerated wear is unnacaptable. Poor materials used for longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Tim O

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOE!
customer_reviews.text: I belieive this is one of their older models. Its selling at a great price here. And its definitely a value shoe. I'm a big guy..with big feet and extra wide width. I brought the 15 extra wide 4E. Fits great. I am very pleased with this shoe and wish it came in different colors. I have to wait on the newer models due to budget restraints. But this model is super. If you got semi-bad feet and want relief..this is the show for you!
customer_reviews.author: EXBIGMIKE

customer_reviews.title: A little clunky and runs big
customer_reviews.text: While I know it's a walking shoe, it's still a bit heavier and clunkier than I expected from NB. It has good support but it runs a bit big (had to return and go down 1/2 size) and the toe is as wide as the ball of the foot (nice!). I still had to lace it all the way up to the collar to get it to fit snugly though. I like it enough not to return it and may like it better as time goes on, but I don't think I would buy this model again at this point.
customer_reviews.author: AudioAlive

customer_reviews.title: Grateful that New Balance still makes these!
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I've shopped in the mall or in sports stores for walking shoes, I've started to think that life had passed me by! So many bright fluorescent colors and mysteriously synthetic materials... just not my style. I try to support local stores, but it isn't always possible. I love the New Balance 877 walking shoe! Great arch support, very breathable, and nice looking. They look good with shorts or with jeans. I'm grateful that New Balance still makes several models with suede and mesh construction.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clifton

customer_reviews.title: Good walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like the toe box width - plenty of room for my toes, unlike some more stylish shoes. The ankle support is very good, too. The laces pass-thru in the tongue is not helpful - with the laces going through it, I can't open the shoe properly to insert my foot. However, that flaw is easily circumvented.
customer_reviews.author: CLG

customer_reviews.title: Lucky Find - Comfortable and cool feet
customer_reviews.text: These are so comfortable in both width and in the cushion. I have difficulty finding comfortable shoes mostly because I have a wide foot (4E) so selection is limited. Ordered in my size and they fit exactly to my measured foot size. They seem to breath well and have fair traction in wet conditions. Live in Seattle so this is an import quality. The laces move well in the eyes so the shoes are easy to put on and tighten evenly. Tongue is padded and comfortable. I have used these mostly for fast walking and for causal wear..
customer_reviews.author: Mick McGrill

customer_reviews.title: Delighful! Great fit out of the box, very comfortable for fast walking, no 'breaking in'.
customer_reviews.text: I had put off buying new shoes to replace my beloved (but worn out) NB 628v4 cross-trainers. I needed a wide shoe, and these 4E width shoes fit perfectly out of the box. I was afraid I'd be stuck returning the shoes in a cycle of trial-and-error, but NB scored a bulls eye with my first try. Hat tip to New Balance and Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: D. Leeper

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from New Balance
customer_reviews.text: I have worn nothing but New Balance for the last 30 years, mainly 900 and 800 series walkers. This 877 felt more like a 500 or 600 series shoe - little support, almost no cushioning, and a generally flimsy feel. I began wearing 928 when they were 924, and consider them a perfect shoe for me. When it is wet outside, I wear the water resistant 968 (started with 962). A great alternative. I have worn other 800 series shoes, and have never had an issue with overall feel or construction, until this 877.
customer_reviews.author: Jim from NY

customer_reviews.title: Great show for wide footed folk
customer_reviews.text: I have worn New Balance for decades becuase of the wide fitting options. I can't even get my foot into Nike or the rest of the popular shoes. But....NB have been for some time reducing the size of the toe box and making the shoes more pointed. I suppose that it looks more fashionable to have pointier shoes, but I found I was no longer able to wear them comfortably......so I bought the old man's alternative which is this shoe. Comfort matters to me so much more than style so these are perfect for me, although I understand that some more fashionable person may disagree.
customer_reviews.author: haruspicio

customer_reviews.title: Like them alot, will buy them again.
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought some of the 877 and she has loved them. I decided to give it a try for myself. I can see why she likes them - these shoes are great! They are very comfortable, breathe well, have good amounts of room in the toes, etc. I like them very much. I replaced the insole with a Dr Scholl's walking insole and I makes them even more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Nash

customer_reviews.title: Comfy shoe for walking half a mile to/from work parking
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a walkable office shoe, so it had to look decent with slacks. I have been happy with the quality of these shoes, and I think the inner liner they came with has more squishy support than I was expecting, which is good.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Athletic Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Really like this shoe. Bought as semi-walker/casual day shoe. Like most NB it is a little wider but it seemed a little "short". It wears well and slips on and ties easily. I swapped out the laces with lace locks to allow more casual "slip on" usage. Good color that matches pretty much anything you wear.
customer_reviews.author: LakeMead Jim

customer_reviews.title: I have bought 4 pairs for my father.
customer_reviews.text: My dad says this is the best walking shoe ever. No other NB (or any brand) is as comfortable and durable as this model. The sole is one piece and is almost plain. He likes that. He also likes that it can get wet and does not break like his other more expensive shoes. NB is one of few companies making 4E extra wide. So this why he has been wearing these for the recent years.
customer_reviews.author: K. Tsai

customer_reviews.title: Good for wide feet people. I'm xwide
customer_reviews.text: I only get new balance because they offer xwide shoes. They live up to their claim. Thank you. As for the insole, it's trash. But aren't all shoes? But this one is really bad haha. Like it slides out trying to put your foot in with the laces tied. Never happened before in any part of my life with shoes. So I bought insoles from Dr. Scholl's and I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Fit my Heel Properly
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing NB 993 style for last 10 years. Great shoe; lasts a long time, but now hard to find. So decided to try a different model. As other reviewers have noted, the 877 is rather wide in the front; looks a bit duckish, if that matters to you. But my main problem was that the heel didn't grip my foot properly, and with every step felt like the shoe was going to come off. Tightening the laces didn't really help. So I sent them back, and bought the 990 model, which is pretty much the same as the old 993.
customer_reviews.author: ronosan

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the brown New Balance walking shoes for several years now but also wanted a more track/casual version to wear with shorts. I waited a long time to get these as they didn't have my size in stock for a long time. But they were worth the wait. They fit just right for my feet and are very comfortable for all day use.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Court

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe to wear all day
customer_reviews.text: New Balance is my athletic shoe of choice. Price-point, fit and durability all score high. This shoe comes in 4E width, which I like a lot. Not because my foot is extra-wide, but because I like extra room in my shoes. I don't like a tight, snug fit as it gets a little uncomfortable after some time. The toe box is very roomy and square. Not the prettiest of shoes; it definitely has that "Dad shoe" look to it. Hey, I'm a dad and proud of it!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat a pair of New Balance for wide feet and for comfort!
customer_reviews.text: Always a good purchase to buy New Balance for my spouse's wide feet. He walks a lot and finds these shoes provide him with comfort. These are nice looking shoes, although the "cloth" area ripped when he stumbled and fell after wearing the shoes only five times. But...the shoes are still wearable and will surely provide him with a long usability.
customer_reviews.author: nvr2amzd

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable Sneaker Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable sneakers that I have ever owned. I usually get Skechers but decided to see if another brand would do better. My podiatrist had New Balance on her recommended list for my flat feet. I did take out the insoles and put in commercial orthotics which I do with every pair of footwear that I purchase. It's standard procedure for my fallen arches. I just got back from a trip to Florida with these sneakers and they worked out perfectly. And my wife really likes the way that they look too. FIVE STARS!
customer_reviews.author: Francis P. Cardella

customer_reviews.title: extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: extremely satisfied with this shoe. fit is perfect (12M) and toe box couldn't be more comfortable; a little wider than a typical 12M but still not clunky looking. lighter than a pair of NB athletic shoes that they replaced but support is still good. look good too (my opinion).
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Not as much padding as I wanted nor arch support
customer_reviews.text: New balance is a well made shoe but I needed to add padding and arch support for walking due to "hard" feeling when feet hit the pavement. I will try a running shoe next. In my experience, shoes are ok for daily use around the house and with padding for long walks.
customer_reviews.author: J2018G

customer_reviews.title: Second Pair.  Good Shoes!...
customer_reviews.text: I like these good-looking shoes for all-around service (walking, trail hiking, light evening activity). Price is great! My only concern is how my toe will, over time, poke a hole through the meshing on the top of the shoe. I find this to be the case on the newer styles of New Balance shoes. Four Stars, check them out!...
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bilek

customer_reviews.title: Purchased these sneakers for my father who has knee issues ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these sneakers for my father who has knee issues and spends 8-9 hours on his feet. He loves the comfort of these sneakers. Only issue is they feel a bit bigger and looser than other sneakers from the past of the same size and width.
customer_reviews.author: Mitesh P.

customer_reviews.title: A really great fitting wide 4E walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are a fine conservative appearing walking sneaker. I just love that New Balance makes these 4E size athletic shoes. Lots of us guys have really wide feet and we don't like squishing our toes into all those standard size shoes. The other big makers like Bike ignore out needs. Thanks New Balance and Amazon for making these available.
customer_reviews.author: RickWAllen

customer_reviews.title: Great Walking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for two pairs of walking shoes and have been frustrated by New Balance. I could not find the features that I needed. The MW877 solved all that. They are NOT foam and they have the Walking Strike Path. I am very pleased that they finally came through! These are excellent walking shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Silverstein

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Comfort and style!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and ordered these for my husband after I read the description. He loves these shoes and for the look and the comfort and thanked me for making such a good choice. We have been married for a very long time so we know what the other likes.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S. Oconnor

customer_reviews.title: New Balance walking shoes are great.
customer_reviews.text: I try to walk three miles several times a week on a local walking trail. I have five pairs of NB shoes. My favorite pair is the 990v4. I was going to buy a pair of 990v5 when I saw these 877 for a great price. My feet are small for my size but very wide. I order 4x or 6x width, but these 877s only come in 2x. They are a little tight but very comfortable and very well constructed. I am very pleased with this purchase. NB is the only brand still made in America as far as I know.
customer_reviews.author: John Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, good fit, nice color
customer_reviews.text: I have been a wearer of New Balance Shoes for years. They are the only one that have a wide toe box that fits my feet. These shoes are just what I wanted. Fit good too. I especially like the muted grey color--it is a good switch from the polished white, or black that most sports shoes come in.---I think it is a good casual sport shoe color.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality construction but terrible style.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of New Balance shoes, probably because they always seem to fit me well, they are well made, and they preform. However, I have to give this model, the MW877 Walking Shoe, a sub-par rating simply because they look so horrible! I understand that these are "walking shoes" but that doesn't mean they need to look like an 80's orthopedic. Everything, from the overly rounded tip, to the green "N" make this shoe look like a clearance rack reject. Sometimes half the battle of exercising is to feel good. And sometimes when you look good, you feel good. Well, these walkers just don't look good at all.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Tak

customer_reviews.title: Now that they fit a little better, these are great shoes that I hope last ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these in size 11D after consulting with New Balance's sizing chart based on my previous shoes. I should have gone with my gut and ordered the next size up (11.5D). The 11D was a little small, but after a few weeks they've seem to have broken in a little. This was my first foray into New Balance and I can see what all the hype is about. Now that they fit a little better, these are great shoes that I hope last a long time (hoping for 2-yrs out of them).
customer_reviews.author: Garrett E

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable walking sneaker!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace my very comfortable NB 'white' sneakers (kids call them old man sneakers) with something a bit more up-to-date. To me, these are still a bit of an old man style (which is okay, since I'm getting there), but I like the gray. They are also very comfortable and breath well with the mesh inserts.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Shoes for walking
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were super comfy for indoor walking, and looked sharp enough that I could wear them at work with khaki pants without raising too many eyebrows - though the work dress code was admittedly very lax. When I moved to a wintery climate, however, they did not hold up at all against the snow and my newish pair ended up looking worse than my older pair, and I was forced to wear actual nice shoes to work thereafter.
customer_reviews.author: Choriambic

customer_reviews.title: Cheap - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are wide enough but the arch support is so bad that my socks were working their way down and bunching up in the toe boxes. I have not seen that happen since my mom bought me fake $8.99 Converse shoes in 1974 when i was in fourth grade..... Seriously.....these shoes REALLY suck!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Boy

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy walking you won't find a more comfortable than this one
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this walking shoe, and dislike nothing. I am 70 years old and walk 7 miles a day in these shoes because they are so comfortable for so long. The very best walking shoe of all that are made by anyone!!!!
customer_reviews.author: William Usilton

customer_reviews.title: This is a good shoe for the wide foot
customer_reviews.text: They make a similar shoe that costs less. I ordered in a pair of each, and this one, the more expensive one was less comfortable to me, so I sent it back. Your mileage may vary. If you have a wide foot, New Balance is a brand you should consider.
customer_reviews.author: readsalot

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Supportive for long walking
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research for a comfortable walking shoe. Decided on the NB brand because it is an American company, and their more expensive shoes are made almost entirely in USA. I walked 2 miles a day and these are truly supportive, and almost feel like you are walking on a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly U.

customer_reviews.title: Typical NB product - Five stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pair of shoes for everyday use, walking around in a suburban environment. The shoes look great with lots of cushion and support. They fit a little loose without socks, but fine with crew socks. I can't attest to the durability yet, but NB shoes have lasted years in the past, and I don't expect anything different with this pair. My only complaint is the Prime order was delayed a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Skhuanoh

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the NB 990 series for many years. Now that I’m older I switched from running to walking. I purchased the NB MW877s because I liked the NB 577 that I used for work. I power walk 5 miles every morning. This is possibly the finest shoe that I have every worn. My gait feels very natural, cushioning is good, and the fit on my size 14 feet is great. They have held up well in the two months that I’ve owned them. I will buy a second pair for every day use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wharton

customer_reviews.title: Product Review
customer_reviews.text: I really like NB shoes. They fit my foot and are very well made. I am always looking for bargains. These didn't cost very much. I think I got them at a pretty big discount. The difference between these 877 and the 990's seems minimal. Maybe I will see the difference after a few months but as of now one is much like the other. The biggest difference is that these cost me $150 less than the 990.
customer_reviews.author: J. Busse

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this sneaker
customer_reviews.text: The 877 is nice looking, very comfortable and an excellent fit. I do my 10,000+ steps 4 times a week with these.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: The Forgotten Wide Feet Community
customer_reviews.text: New Balance seems to be the only company that realizes some people have wide feet. No matter what I review and about to order I go to the size chart which only has D medium as the only choice. Click away again and come back to New Balance. This shoe fits perfectly and has a wide toe area that allows one's feet to spread out comfortably. I only wish New Balance or someone else would manufacture a wide driving shoe. I guess automobile drivers all have medium size feet. I like this product a lot and thank New Balance for thinking about the wide feet crowd.
customer_reviews.author: Montague Burton

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Was going to buy this one to replace the ASICS walking sneakers re worn out, still very comfortable with gel cushion. The new ASICS wasn’t as comfortable as it seems to be tighter than the older one. Saw this NB in Amazon with tons of positive review. Liked it with more width. Very disappointed as there is no cushion built in with these walking sneakers. Will go back to ASICS for much more comfortable sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Ho

product_meta.title: New Balance mens MX877 Cardio Training-M Mx877
feature_bullets: Classic synthetic-and-mesh walking shoe featuring seamless logos at sides
